summary: Email exchange between Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex Conlon and an unnamed attorney regarding the SDNY's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling a meeting with a female witness, planning outreach to other individuals, and note that upcoming discussions will cover difficult topics including Epstein's conduct with a specific individual and Giglio subjects.

persons.name: Alex Conlon
persons.context: Correspondent and prosecutor with the Southern District of New York, coordinating a meeting and outreach related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be part of the legal team involved in the investigation coordination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the SDNY investigation; his conduct with a particular individual is noted as a topic for upcoming difficult discussions.

connections.description: Both are legal professionals copied on the same email correspondence regarding the Epstein investigation.
Conlon, as an AUSA, is investigating Epstein as indicated by the discussion of covering Epstein's conduct.

events.title: Email coordination for witness meeting
events.description: Alex Conlon emails to schedule a meeting with a female witness for the SDNY Epstein investigation, noting she plans to make phone calls to two individuals.

events.title: Follow-up on investigation outreach
events.description: An unnamed attorney emails Alex Conlon confirming no objection to note-taking during witness outreach and requesting to schedule a meeting with the witness before June.

events.title: Planned difficult witness discussion
events.description: Prosecutors plan to meet with a witness to address difficult topics including Giglio subjects and a review of Epstein's conduct with a particular individual.

locations: Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP, 350 Fifth Avenue, Suite 7110, New York, New York
keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was active and coordinating witness interviews as of May 2019.
Prosecutors planned to discuss 'difficult topics, including Giglio subjects and some review of Epstein's conduct with [a particular individual]' in an upcoming meeting.
A female witness was making independent phone calls to two individuals as part of the investigation outreach.
The correspondence indicates prosecutorial sensitivity to witness schedules and a desire to complete initial discussions before June 2019.
